bibl.title: In the matter of the application of George W. Anderson for a writ of Habeas Corpus. Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: In the District Court, Of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding Terms at Seattle, for the County of King. HABEAS CORPUS.

The People of the United States of America, to the Sheriff of King County To J.C. Mitchell Chief of Police Seattle Greeting: We command you, that you have the body of Geo W. Anderson by you imprisoned and detained as it is said, together with the time and cause of such imprisonment and detention, by whatsoever name said Geo W. Anderson shall be called or charged, before the HON. RICHARD A. JONES, Judge of the aforesaid Court at Seattle forthwith to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning him the said Geo. W. Anderson And have you then and there this writ. WITNESS THE HON. Richard A. Jones C H Hanford Judge of the said District Court, and the seal thereof this 1st day of October A.D. 1889. RM Hopkins Clerk.

Territory of Washington King County ss. J.C. Mitchell Chief of Police of it City of Seattle in King County as herby certify That J.C. has the petitioner Geo. W. Anderson under arrest and in my custody. My virtue of a warrant of arrest issued October 2nd 1889 and of the Justice Court for Seattle Precinct in said county which said warrant attatched and made at Seattle of this : that said warrant issued and of said court upon a complaint files in order of Justice Court this 1st day of October 1889, changing said petition as alleged in said warrant and said cause is still pleading for and in said court: I further certify that I have now said petitioner in the court. Dated at Seattle October 1st 1889. JC Mitchell Chief of Police afpaid

No. 7262 In the District Court, Third Judicial District, Holding Terms at Seattle, W. T. In the Matter of the Application of Geo. W. Anderson for Writ of Habeas Corpus. Habeas Corpus. Remanded Returned and filed this 1st day of October A. D. 1889 R M Hopkins Clerk. By H. T. Hannon Deputy Clerk.
